alert.note: Alert for Stone (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 04 at 7:35AM CST until March 05 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM CST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Missouri, including the following counties, Barry, Christian and Stone. * WHEN...Until 1000 AM CST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 734 AM CST, River gauge reports indicated that flooding continued along the James River and Flat Creek from the heavy rain that occurred Thursday afternoon into Friday morning. Flooding is already occurring in the warned area and will continue through this morning. - This includes the following low water crossings... Wilson`s Creek at Old Limey Road, Rockhouse Creek at Farm Road 2145, Flat Creek at Highway U, Flat Creek at Highway C, Green Valley Creek at Holder RD, Dry Crane Creek at Jasmine Road and Little Crane Creek at Old Wire Road. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Nixa, Cassville, Clever, Crane, Reeds Spring, Galena, Butterfield, Mccord Bend, Hurley, Elsey, Wheelerville, Cape Fair, Jenkins, Ponce de Leon, Mcdowell, Boaz and Table Rock Lake. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles.
